seg-source.mrk: Application development overview

target.mrk: Application development overview

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> application developers use the Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) API, the application programming interface that makes it possible to access relational databases from Java programs.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> application developers use the Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) API, the application programming interface that makes it possible to access relational databases from Java programs.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> application developers use the Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) API, the application programming interface that makes it possible to access relational databases from Java programs.

trans-unit.source: The JDBC API is part of the Java Platform, Standard Edition and is not specific to . It consists of the java.sql and javax.sql packages, which is a set of classes and interfaces that make it possible to access databases (from a number of different vendors, not just ) from a Java application.

seg-source.mrk: The JDBC API is part of the Java Platform, Standard Edition and is not specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

It consists of the java.sql and javax.sql packages, which is a set of classes and interfaces that make it possible to access databases (from a number of different vendors, not just ) from a Java application.

It consists of the java.sql and javax.sql packages, which is a set of classes and interfaces that make it possible to access databases (from a number of different vendors, not just ) from a Java application.

trans-unit.source: To develop <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> applications successfully, you will need to learn the JDBC API. This section does not teach you how to program with the JDBC API.

seg-source.mrk: To develop <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> applications successfully, you will need to learn the JDBC API.
This section does not teach you how to program with the JDBC API.

target.mrk: To develop <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> applications successfully, you will need to learn the JDBC API.
This section does not teach you how to program with the JDBC API.

trans-unit.source: This section covers the details of application programming that are specific to <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> applications. For example, all JDBC applications typically start their DBMS's JDBC driver and use a connection URL to connect to a database. This chapter gives you the details of how to start <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s JDBC driver and how to work with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s connection URL to accomplish various tasks. It also covers essential <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> concepts such as the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system.

trans-unit.source: application developers will need to learn SQL. SQL is the standard query language used with relational databases and is not tied to a particular programming language. No matter how a particular RDBMS has been implemented, the user can design databases and insert, modify, and retrieve data using the standard SQL statements and well-defined data types. SQL-92 is the version of SQL standardized by ANSI and ISO in 1992; supports entry-level SQL-92 as well as some higher-level features. Entry-level SQL-92 is a subset of full SQL-92 specified by ANSI and ISO that is supported by nearly all major DBMSs today. This chapter does not teach you SQL. You will find reference information about the particulars of 's implementation of SQL in the .

SQL-92 is the version of SQL standardized by ANSI and ISO in 1992; <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports entry-level SQL-92 as well as some higher-level features.
Entry-level SQL-92 is a subset of full SQL-92 specified by ANSI and ISO that is supported by nearly all major DBMSs today.
This chapter does not teach you SQL.

You will find reference information about the particulars of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s implementation of SQL in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph></cite>.

Entry-level SQL-92 is a subset of full SQL-92 specified by ANSI and ISO that is supported by nearly all major DBMSs today.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements the JDBC API so as to allow <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to serve as a resource manager in a Java EE compliant system.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements the JDBC API so as to allow <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to serve as a resource manager in a Java EE compliant system.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements the JDBC API so as to allow <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to serve as a resource manager in a Java EE compliant system.

trans-unit.source: When an application embeds <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, application users take on the role of database administrator and must maintain the integrity of the database. See "Part Two: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Administration Guide" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for information on administrative tasks such as backing up and restoring databases. In particular, see the topic "Maintaining database integrity" for information on preventing database corruption. You will need to make this information available to your users.

You will need to make this information available to your users.
